Here in NY, Open Enrollment runs until January 31.
Use this time to:
👉Evaluate your options.
👉See if you can save money.
👉Most importantly, Get Covered. 

Head to  http://NYStateofhealth.ny.gov  to learn more! pic.twitter.com/yQGI3m7RFT

ICYMI — The House recently passed legislation I’m proud to co-sponsor to eliminate the SALT Cap and finally bring relief to countless middle-class New Yorkers. https://www.rollcall.com/news/congress/house-passes-restored-salt-deduction-bill …

I’m so proud that for the first time in 20 years, our bipartisan appropriations agreement included critical funding for gun violence research. This is a national epidemic – we need all hands on deck to #EndGunViolence and keep our communities safe. https://abcnews.go.com/Health/congress-approves-unprecedented-25-million-gun-violence-research/story?id=67762555 …

As we head into 2020 and a new legislative session, I want to know what you’d like to see in the year ahead – use the hashtag #NY25Priorities to share your top concerns for the new year! pic.twitter.com/tZZeK7l1Vx

.@RepJohnLewis is the embodiment of a public servant and an American hero. My thoughts are with our entire Jewish community as we reckon with another horrible act of anti-semitism — and one that came during the peaceful holiday of Hanukkah. Deaf and hard-of-hearing passengers deserve the same travel experience as anyone else. https://twitter.com/MarleeMatlin/status/1210263674197168128 …

In 2017, I authored the New York Buy American Act to promote America’s steel and iron industry and to create jobs for New Yorkers. Grateful to @NYGovCuomo for his commitment to bringing high speed rail to New York State. Looking forward to opportunities to partner and help make this transformative infrastructure and technology a reality for our communities. https://twitter.com/NYGovCuomo/status/1210238687105224705 …
Wishing joy and prosperity to all those celebrating #Kwanzaa. May the Nguzo Saba guide you to success in the new year. pic.twitter.com/9hbL5ybh8j

We made a promise to the American people that we would not move forward with the #USMCA agreement unless it contained significant improvements and robust enforcement mechanisms—and that is exactly what we have delivered. https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/12/19/21013178/usmca-trade-deal-passes-house-vote-approve-bipartisan-nafta-trump …

I was proud to vote in support of a bipartisan #USMCA agreement that ensures fair trade practices, implements critical worker protections, eliminates giveaways to the pharmaceutical industry, and takes steps to protect our environment.

We need to expand access to quality, affordable healthcare - not continue dismantling the strides we have made. #ProtectOurCare https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1207427647137026053 …

It’s never acceptable to disparage someone’s loss - and it’s even more callous during the holidays, when the pain of grief stings more than usual. The President’s comments last night were truly shameful.

I stand with you, @RepDebDingell. https://twitter.com/RepDebDingell/status/1207494427968716801 …

It has become clear: the President has abused the powers of his public office, leveraged a foreign government for political benefit, and obstructed Congressional oversight of his conduct.

That is why today, I cast my vote to impeach President Trump.

My full statement: pic.twitter.com/JbJdJ7o9QH
We are at a crossroads – the future of our country hinges on decisions like the one we are making today. pic.twitter.com/KfB7LBfecn

This is a profound moment in our nation's history. It is not just our responsibility, but our somber obligation to protect our republic and uphold the very tenets it was founded upon. Watch live here. https://twitter.com/HouseDemocrats/status/1207299865224470528 …
🤷🏻‍♂️ https://twitter.com/owillis/status/1207061939106566150 …

When I talk to my grandchildren about right and wrong, I want to be able to tell them I’ve always done my best to uphold what is good, what is just, and what is fair.

That means taking action to hold President Trump accountable for his alarming and unlawful behavior. pic.twitter.com/z0QuKn6ov4
Grateful to @SenSchumer and @SenGillibrand for their partnership in helping to ensure this critical funding was part of our bipartisan appropriations package for Fiscal Year 2020.

I'm so proud to have helped secure no less than $80 million in funding for the @UofR's Laboratory for Laser Energetics, which continues to cement its place as a world-class institution and leader in cutting edge scientific research. https://morelle.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-joe-morelle-advances-investments-america-s-families …

Instead of supporting the well-being of families and individuals, the Trump administration continues to strip away benefits from those most in need. 

I am troubled, yet unfortunately not surprised, by this callous decision and utter disregard for the needs of everyday Americans.

Tightening work requirements for SNAP eligibility serves only to further perpetuate the cycle of poverty and makes it more difficult for vulnerable adults to become self-sufficient. It is especially egregious that the decision comes during the holiday season—a season of giving. https://twitter.com/kylegriffin1/status/1202304075985018880 …

The right to cast a ballot is fundamental to American democracy – and it must never be threatened. Today and everyday, we remind ourselves that there is much work to be done in pursuit of a world without barriers or discrimination based on your abilities.
